Summary of evidence: Incidence of penile cancer varies according to geographical location, race and ethnicity.
Western developed countries have seen a slight increase in incidence, which may be caused by higher   HPV infection rates.

In analogy to other HPV-associated cancers, HPV status may influence DSS of penile cancer, but   more data is needed, underlining the importance of routine assessment of HPV status in all penile   cancer patients.
